intro: Chuquiraga ulicina subsp. ulicina, commonly known as the Andean burr. It is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly in the Andes region. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and spiny, bract-like leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. This subspecies is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
